content.title: State Reward to the Recipient of National Award
content.details: The scheme 'State Reward to the Recipient of National Award' has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa as a token of appreciation in order to support and promote the local artists, who have received recognition at the National and International levels.
benefits: A financial purse to the extent of ₹ 1,00,000/- per individual
eligibility: The applicant should be a Goan artist who has received any of the following National Awards: Sahitya Akademi Award, Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, Lalit Kala Akademi Award, Padma Award for the contribution to the field of art & culture, Bhartiya Dnyanpeeth Award, Saraswati Sanman, Sahitya Akademi Jivan Gaurav Puraskar, Sangeet Natak Academy Fellowship, or any other National or International Award recognized by the Government of Goa.
Those living artists who have already received such awards shall also be eligible for this scheme.
An artist shall be eligible to receive the benefit only once, even if they receive more than one award.
exclusions: No award shall be given posthumously.
The Sahitya Akademi Award for translation will not be considered for this scheme.
content.application_process: The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Goa. Take a print of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and submit the application form along with the required documents.
documents_required: Residential Certificate proving that the applicant has spent at least 10 years in Goa
Proof of having received any of the National Awards mentioned in the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Who is the designated officer to contact for inquiries or applications related to this scheme?
faqs.answer: Interested individuals can contact the ACO III at the Directorate of Art & Culture in Goa.

faqs.question: Are there any residency requirements for Goan artists to qualify for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Goan artist is defined as an artist who has spent at least 10 years in Goa.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible artists receive a financial purse to the extent of Rs. 1,00,000/- per individual.

faqs.question: Is this reward available posthumously?
faqs.answer: No, this reward is not given posthumously.

faqs.question: Can an artist who has received multiple National Awards receive this state reward more than once?
faqs.answer: No, under this scheme, an artist can receive the benefit only once.

faqs.question: Are awards given for translations eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, Sahitya Akademi Awards for translation are not considered eligible.

faqs.question: Which National Awards make an artist eligible for this state reward?
faqs.answer: Artists who have received a range of National Awards including Sahitya Akademi Award, Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, and others are eligible.

faqs.question: How is the financial purse of Rs. 1,00,000/- distributed to the eligible artists?
faqs.answer: The financial purse is typically provided as a lump sum amount to each eligible artist.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of artists who can receive this state reward in a given year?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not specify a limit on the number of artists who can receive the reward.

faqs.question: Can an artist who has moved away from Goa still be considered a 'Goan artist' for the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: To be considered a 'Goan artist', the artist should have spent at least 10 years of their creative lifetime in Goa.
